channel.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
channel.description:
DFM Form Parser by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
Screenshot: [img]http://img89.imageshack.us/img89/9878/dfmparserv25byronsh6.png[/img]
Description: When you make a form using the form editor in scar and save the file. You create a DFM file. This DFM file can be translated into SCAR code using the SCAR's "load form" option, but compared to this, it's obsolete. Check out the features!
If you still don't find this useful, I can totally clear it up for you. This script in essence can make any doosh bag make a perfect form! Here are the steps to use this. - First, go into scar's Form Editor. Tools > Form Editor. - Now just make a totally random form. Throw components on there like crazy and do whatever. - Once you're done with the form editor, click the Save Icon and save the file somewhere like in My Documents or something. - After that is saved, open up my script, and type in the exact location of the file. Check some options if you like. - Click on Generate Code. There should be code now in the memo box. Now either, save the file to a .scar file using that button, or click on Copy to Clipboard and paste the code into a new scar window. - Finally, when the newly generated code is in the scar window, Run the script, and viola! You have just made a PERFECT FORM! :)
Features: * Automatically create the entire form's code with safe statements! * FreeForm() to dissolve any memory leaks. * Change the form name in the DFM form easily in case you made a mistake. * Able to make your form popup in the center of your screen. * For those advanced users, you can see how long it takes for your form to compile. * To improve performance and decrease the size of your scar file, you can convert the statements into a WITH Statement! * If you don't like how the SCAR window stays in the background when your form pops up, no worries, you can set it to generate the code to minimize it and then display your form! * Able to copy code to clipboard and paste it somewhere else. * Resize window to better see the code. * Saves all settings including height and width of form. * Disable resize. * Disable maximize/minimize. * Disable system menu. * Force the form to stay on top of all other windows. * Able to see only safe procedures and vars code. * Try/Except error checking option. * Able to see how many lines of code and how many characters total. * ReadOnly ability. * Variables shown as Label1, Label2, Label3 : TLabel; and the like. * Replace width and height with clientwidth and clientheight. * Browse button for easy file location. * Save the code to a .scar file. * Break down long variable lists of the same type. * StatusBar to show you detailed information about the generated code.
Updated to v.25. Here is the changelog. [code] [ Change Log - From v.23 to v.25 ] [ - FEATURE - If you have 4 variables or more of the same type such ] [ as Label1, Label2, etc : TLabel, it will break it down each time so ] [ the variables do not go off the page. :) ] [ - Fixed bug: If you edited a label's font or size, the DFM creator ] [ in SCAR will automatically add an unknown property called ] [ ParentFont. In the beginning, I thought ParentFont only came up for ] [ the TForm. I was wrong, so this is not ignored like 10 others. ] [ - Fixed bug: If you put in a single quote or another character that ] [ SCAR automatically changes to decimal (#39 = '), then you would get ] [ an error message. ] [ - Fixed bug: Set edFormName back to defaults if the Clear Settings ] [ button is clicked. ] [ - Added saving of form position when exiting. ] [ - Added prompts for the Copy To Clipboard and Save Buttons if the ] [ memo is empty. ] [ - Added the Save Button once again due to the addition of the ] [ TSaveDialog. ] [ - Renamed a few variables so it would be easier for me. This is ] [ more of a feature for me, than for you. :) ] [ - Added a reload settings button in case you clicked on reset by ] [ mistake and didn't want to check each option again. The reload ] [ button will only get settings from the last time you Xed out of the ] [ parser. ] [ - Added a status bar to display # of lines, characters, and ] [ generation time and removed 5 labels since we added the status bar. ] [ - Added a procedure Indent to clean up a little code. ] [ - Added support for Tab.Strings as well as any .Strings. ] [ - Changed Refresh Settings to Clear Settings. ] [ - If a TImage is placed on the form, and you have loaded a picture ] [ the program will ignore it since the functionality does not exist ] [ in SCAR, unless you paint the image using several procedures. I ] [ would add that, but right now I'm busy studying and this is the ] [ best I can do. I may add that in later. A constant boolean is set ] [ by default to True to show a msg box. ] [/code]
Script is attached! Hope it helps you as much as it has helped me.
84 people from this website downloaded this script before I added the current version.
~Ron
PS: Last tested for SCAR 3.12c.

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Sounds like a good idea sonny.

If a “Save All Form Settings” was checked, then I would have to automatically create an OnExit procedure and a const of the InitFormSettingsFolder and have it generate a random name for that. Then when the form is exited, have it save each form variable’s contents with a type of TEdit contents, TMemo contents, selected TCheckBox’s, selected TRadioButton, selected TListBox, selected TComboBox.
In the form code, I would also have to have it load the settings. So in each TEdit, TMemo, etc, I would need something like:
Edit1.Text := LoadSetting(InitFormSettingsFolder, ‘InitFormEdit1’);

Seems like a bit of work and this idea has crossed my mind, but thank you for suggesting it. I don’t know why I didn’t do it before.

The next version may be delayed because I’m planning a big feature larger than the one you suggested. So it will take some time. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 03, 2007, 10:36:31 PM[/size][hr]I don’t know if anyone is wondering, but here is what remains for the next version. I keep what I need to do before a release in my comments.

[  To do before release:                                                 ]
[    * Future problems may arise when component name matches or contains ]
[    a property's name. Use a function to grab just the property, ignore ]
[    text in between single quotes, and make sure the keyword searched   ]
[    for isn't part of the component's name.                             ]
[    * Finish SCAR to DFM.                                               ]
[      * Support for Parents and multiple parents.                       ]
[        - PLAN - Have it create TGroup/TPanel normally, then when an    ]
[        object is parented to that, then shift the new object in        ]
[        between the TGroup/TPanel, right before its end and indent each ]
[        of its lines by 2. Same goes for an object parented to a group  ]
[        within a group.                                                 ]
[      * Check for decimal characters in the # form. Ex. #39 = '         ]
[    * CheckBox setting to save all values of form components.           ]
[      * Edit box text, radio buttons ticked, checkboxes ticked,         ]
[      checklistbox, labeled edit, memo text, listbox items, combobox    ]
[      items, richedit text. - As suggested by sonny bill 9              ]
[    * As an extra, try to keep learning C++ and eventually convert this ]
[    code into C++. More efficient, and no need for SCAR to run it. Not  ]
[    necessary, but would be a plus. Code would still be open source.    ]
[    * Sort out the status bar messages. It's pretty fucked up.          ]

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I found the problem. The form editor in the Form Editor in SCAR let you blank the variable name of the Edit box. Since the parser couldn’t find the variable, it couldn’t find the object, when it couldn’t find the object, it just printed out whatever it could.

I have a fix for it though. If it is empty, the script will now generate a randomized name. Thank you script_owned4. The next version is going to be better and is going to come soon.

Read full topic
item.source: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

Line 10: [Error] (10:1): colon (':') expected in script C:\New Folder\SCAR 3.12\Scripts\PowerCutter-V1BETA.scar

Error Here’s the script:

program New;

var
  // InitForm variables.
  frmDesign : TForm;
  Label1 : TLabel;
  Label2 : TLabel;
  Edit1 : TEdit;
  TEdit
    Left = 121
    Top = 33
    Width = 121
    Height = 21
    TabOrder = 9
  end
  object Button1 : TButton;
  ComboBox1 : TComboBox;

// This form was parsed using: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron.
procedure InitForm;
var
  TimeInitForm : Integer;
begin
  TimeInitForm := GetSystemTime;
  frmDesign := CreateForm;
  with frmDesign do
  begin
    Position := poScreenCenter;
    Width := 473;
    Height := 397;
    Caption := 'Username/Password';
    Color := clBtnFace;
    Font.Color := clWindowText;
    Font.Height := -11;
    Font.Name := 'MS Sans Serif';
    Font.Style := [];
    PixelsPerInch := 96;
  end;
  Label1 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
  with Label1 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 66;
    Top := 38;
    Width := 48;
    Height := 13;
    Caption := 'Username';
  end;
  Label2 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
  with Label2 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 68;
    Top := 65;
    Width := 46;
    Height := 13;
    Caption := 'Password';
  end;
  Edit1 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
  with Edit1 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 123;
    Top := 61;
    Width := 121;
    Height := 21;
    TabOrder := 8;
  end;
  TEdit
    Left = 121
    Top = 33
    Width = 121
    Height = 21
    TabOrder = 9
  end
  object Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
  with TEdit
    Left = 121
    Top = 33
    Width = 121
    Height = 21
    TabOrder = 9
  end
  object Button1 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 121;
    Top := 33;
    Width := 121;
    Height := 21;
    TabOrder := 9;
  end;
  Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
  with Button1 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 141;
    Top := 150;
    Width := 75;
    Height := 25;
    Caption := 'Start';
    TabOrder := 10;
  end;
  ComboBox1 := TComboBox.Create(frmDesign);
  with ComboBox1 do
  begin
    Parent := frmDesign;
    Left := 115;
    Top := 105;
    Width := 145;
    Height := 21;
    ItemHeight := 13;
    TabOrder := 11;
    Text := 'Active?';
    with ComboBox1.Items do
    begin
      Add('True');
      Add('False');
    end;
  end;
  WriteLn('InitForm compiled in ' + IntToStr(GetSystemTime - TimeInitForm) + ' milliseconds!');
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
  V : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(V, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('InitForm', V);
end;

procedure ShowInitFormModal;
begin
  frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowInitFormModal;
var
  V : TVariantArray;
begin
  SetArrayLength(V, 0);
  ThreadSafeCall('ShowInitFormModal', V);
end;

procedure MainInitForm;
begin
  try
    SafeInitForm;
    SafeShowInitFormModal;
  finally
    FreeForm(frmDesign);
  except
    WriteLn('An error seems to have occurred in: InitForm');
  end;
end;

begin
  ClearDebug;
  MainInitForm;
end.

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hey Ron, haven’t seen you in a while
I gave ur script a test, it’s nice, but I found a tiny buggar
It seems you didn’t account for SCAR’s new ability to use invisible components in the form editor…
Tried with a TTimer:

Timer1 := TTimer.Create(frmDesign); with Timer1 do begin Parent := frmDesign; Left := 8; Top := 104; end;
Invisible components don’t have a parent Well, at least a TTimer doesn’t, not 100% sure for the rest, but it should be the same

Read full topic

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Updated to v.25.

Changelog:

[  Change Log - From v.23 to v.25                                        ]
[    - FEATURE - If you have 4 variables or more of the same type such   ]
[    as Label1, Label2, etc : TLabel, it will break it down each time so ]
[    the variables do not go off the page. :)                            ]
[    - Fixed bug: If you edited a label's font or size, the DFM creator  ]
[    in SCAR will automatically add an unknown property called           ]
[    ParentFont. In the beginning, I thought ParentFont only came up for ]
[    the TForm. I was wrong, so this is not ignored like 10 others.      ]
[    - Fixed bug: If you put in a single quote or another character that ]
[    SCAR automatically changes to decimal (#39 = '), then you would get ]
[    an error message.                                                   ]
[    - Fixed bug: Set edFormName back to defaults if the Clear Settings  ]
[    button is clicked.                                                  ]
[    - Added saving of form position when exiting.                       ]
[    - Added prompts for the Copy To Clipboard and Save Buttons if the   ]
[    memo is empty.                                                      ]
[    - Added the Save Button once again due to the addition of the       ]
[    TSaveDialog.                                                        ]
[    - Renamed a few variables so it would be easier for me. This is     ]
[    more of a feature for me, than for you. :)                          ]
[    - Added a reload settings button in case you clicked on reset by    ]
[    mistake and didn't want to check each option again. The reload      ]
[    button will only get settings from the last time you Xed out of the ]
[    parser.                                                             ]
[    - Added a status bar to display # of lines, characters, and         ]
[    generation time and removed 5 labels since we added the status bar. ]
[    - Added a procedure Indent to clean up a little code.               ]
[    - Added support for Tab.Strings as well as any .Strings.            ]
[    - Changed Refresh Settings to Clear Settings.                       ]
[    - If a TImage is placed on the form, and you have loaded a picture  ]
[    the program will ignore it since the functionality does not exist   ]
[    in SCAR, unless you paint the image using several procedures. I     ]
[    would add that, but right now I'm busy studying and this is the     ]
[    best I can do. I may add that in later. A constant boolean is set   ]
[    by default to True to show a msg box.                               ]

Read full topic
item.source: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

looks like a good script but the problem is that i dont know how to get it to change the username/password this is the code[code]//script only cuts oak
//have runescape map/veiw at it highest point facing north
//stand behind lumbridge general store
//see http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,187285.msg1691689.html#new
//for picture
//power cutter by jason aka sonny bill 9
//setup
//drag cross hair onto rs screen
//press play
//login cut and drop
program autocutter;
{.include srl/srl.scar}
{.include srl/srl/skill/woodcutting.scar}
const
username =’’; //add your username
password =’’; //add your password
var
Chops, Loads: Integer;
// InitForm variables.
EndInitForm : Boolean;
frmDesign : TForm;
Label1 : TLabel;
Label2 : TLabel;
Label3 : TLabel;
Edit1 : TEdit;
Edit2 : TEdit;
Button1 : TButton;
procedure login;
begin
Movemousesmooth(468, 291);
wait(1000);
holdmouse(468, 291,true);
wait(100);
releasemouse(468, 291,true);
wait(1000);
sendkeyswait(username,400,100);
wait(1000);
Movemousesmooth(347, 276);
wait(1000);
holdmouse(347, 276,true);
wait(100);
releasemouse(347, 276,true);
wait(1000);
sendkeyswait(password,400,100);
wait(1000);
Movemousesmooth(331, 320);
wait(1000);
holdmouse(331, 320,true);
wait(100);
releasemouse(331, 320,true);
wait(1000);
Movemousesmooth(398, 344);
wait(7000);
holdmouse(398, 344,true);
wait(100);
releasemouse(398, 344,true);
wait(3000);
end;

procedure drop;
begin
gametab(4);
status(‘Dropping’);
if (invfull = true) then
mousespeed:=1;
dropto(1,28);
wait(2000+random(550));
end;

procedure cut;
begin
movemousesmooth(233, 216)
if(IsUpTextMulti(‘chop’,‘op do’,‘down’))then
wait(1000)
clickmouse(233,216,true)
wait(20000)//time it takes to chop the tree in miliseconds
movemousesmooth(255, 14)
if(IsUpTextMulti(‘chop’,‘op do’,‘down’))then
wait(3000)
holdmouse(255, 14,true)
wait(100)
releasemouse(255, 14,true)
wait(20000)//time it takes to chop the tree in miliseconds
movemousesmooth(274, 320)
if(IsUpTextMulti(‘chop’,‘op do’,‘down’))then
holdmouse(274, 320,true)
wait(100)
releasemouse(274, 320,true)
wait(20000)//time it takes to chop the tree in miliseconds
repeat until(invfull)
end;
procedure Report;
begin
ClearDebug;
Writeln(’<thankyou sonny bill 9s powerchopper >’);
Writeln(‘Worked for ’ + TimeRunning);
Writeln(‘you have done’ + IntToStr(Loads) + ’ loads.’);
Writeln(‘you have cut’ + IntToStr(chops) + ‘logs.’);
end;

// When the form is closed, this code will be executed.
procedure InitFormOnClose(Sender : TObject; var Action : TCloseAction);
begin
if(not(frmDesign.ModalResult = 1))then
EndInitForm := True;
end;

// This form was parsed using: DFM Form Parser v.22 by Ron.
procedure InitForm;
var
TimeInitForm : Integer;
begin
TimeInitForm := GetSystemTime;
frmDesign := CreateForm;
with frmDesign do
begin
OnClose := @InitFormOnClose;
Position := poScreenCenter;
BorderStyle := bsSingle;
BorderIcons := [biMinimize,biSystemMenu];
FormStyle := fsStayOnTop;
Caption := ‘SONNY BILL 9S OAK AUTOCUTTER!!!’;
ClientHeight := 261;
ClientWidth := 511;
Color := clBlue;
Font.Color := clWindowText;
Font.Height := -11;
Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Font.Style := [];
PixelsPerInch := 96;
end;
Label1 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
with Label1 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 58;
Top := 111;
Width := 211;
Height := 24;
Caption := ‘type your username here’;
Font.Color := clWindowText;
Font.Height := -19;
Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Font.Style := [];
ParentFont := False;
end;
Label2 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
with Label2 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 59;
Top := 146;
Width := 207;
Height := 24;
Caption := ‘type your password here’;
Font.Color := clWindowText;
Font.Height := -19;
Font.Name := ‘MS Sans Serif’;
Font.Style := [];
ParentFont := False;
end;
Label3 := TLabel.Create(frmDesign);
with Label3 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 61;
Top := 16;
Width := 401;
Height := 44;
Hint := ‘ehh the name …man your dumb’;
Caption := ’ SONNY BILL 9S AUTOCUTTER ';
Color := clWindowFrame;
Font.Color := clYellow;
Font.Height := -37;
Font.Name := ‘Freestyle Script’;
Font.Style := [fsBold];
ParentColor := False;
ParentFont := False;
end;
Edit1 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
with Edit1 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 276;
Top := 114;
Width := 121;
Height := 21;
TabOrder := 8;
Text := ‘username’;
end;
Edit2 := TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
with Edit2 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 276;
Top := 146;
Width := 121;
Height := 21;
TabOrder := 9;
Text := ‘password’;
end;
Button1 := TButton.Create(frmDesign);
with Button1 do
begin
Parent := frmDesign;
Left := 218;
Top := 202;
Width := 75;
Height := 25;
Caption := ‘start script!’;
ModalResult := 1;
TabOrder := 10;
end;
WriteLn(‘InitForm compiled in ’ + IntToStr(GetSystemTime - TimeInitForm) + ’ milliseconds!’);
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var
V : TVariantArray;
begin
SetArrayLength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, V);
end;

procedure ShowInitFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowInitFormModal;
var
V : TVariantArray;
begin
SetArrayLength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowInitFormModal’, V);
end;

procedure MainInitForm;
begin
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowInitFormModal;
FreeForm(frmDesign);
end;

begin
ClearDebug;
MainInitForm;
if(EndInitForm)then
TerminateScript;
ActivateClient;
SetUpSRL;
login;
cut;
if (invfull) then
drop;
repeat until(false)
report
end.[/code]if you run the script you will notice that the form asks you to type your username and password but it doesnt change it can anyone help me??

Read full topic
item.source: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @skys_shadow skys shadow
item.description:
@skys_shadow wrote:

Thanks Ron, this takes a lot of time off of making a good form!

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hmm how strange. You know. Starblaster100 also had a few problems before with a previous version of this program. It was due to an array issue. The script worked fine for most people, but for his computer, it didn’t work at all and it gave the same messages you pointed out.

Look for this code “SetArrayLength(Titles, 0);” and delete that line. If that doesn’t fix it, then please add me on MSN or AIM and if you could, please help me figure it out. Thank you.

Read full topic

@mjordan wrote:

Yeah, I have Divi 3.01 and I ran it again. These little boxes pop up that says these things. This is in order of what they say, and when I press ok on one, the next one pops up:

[ul][li]could not call proc[/li]
[li]out of stack range[/li]
[li]out of global vars range[/li]
[li]could not call proc[/li][/ul]

item.title: DFM Form Parser v.25 by Ron - Fix Up Your Forms! Works with Divi!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

On SCAR 2.03, it won’t work because the functions have been changed for Divi. I just downloaded this script and ran it, and it worked fine. Try redownloading and running it again.

If that does not work, then try to run it on SCAR Divi 3.01 in case you don’t have it.
